meanings.definition: A form or version of something that differs in some respect from other forms or versions.
meanings.sent1: There are many variants of the game that people enjoy playing.
meanings.sent2: The store offers different variants of the product to suit various preferences.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally bought two variants of the same book, thinking they were different stories.
meanings.sent4: Her painting was a unique variant of the artist's usual style, incorporating bold colors and abstract shapes.
meanings.sent5: The chef's special dish was a delicious variant of the traditional recipe, adding a spicy twist.

meanings.definition: A different version of a gene.
meanings.sent1: Scientists discovered a rare variant of the gene that is linked to the disease.
meanings.sent2: The genetic test revealed a harmful variant of the gene that runs in the family.
meanings.sent3: The mutant variant of the gene caused the plant to grow in unexpected ways.
meanings.sent4: The new variant of the gene acted like a silent disruptor, affecting the organism's development.
meanings.sent5: The rare variant of the gene was like a hidden treasure waiting to be uncovered by researchers.
